text:
Venture capital (VC) funds invest in companies in the early stages of their development.
The investment often is in the form of equity but can be in convertible preferred shares
or convertible debt. While the risk of start-up companies is often great, returns on
successful companies can be very high. This is often the case when a company has grown
to the point where it is sold (at least in part) to the public via an IPO.
